com.googlecode.sarasvati

Interface Token

  • All Known Subinterfaces:
    ArcToken, NodeToken
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    HibArcToken, HibNodeToken, MemArcToken, MemNodeToken

    public interface Token
    The set of tokens in a process represent the current state of the workflow. There are two types of tokens, node tokens and arc tokens. Node tokens point at nodes and arc tokens point to arcs. Tokens are never moved. They may be marked as complete and new tokens will be created in the areas of the workflow now in progress.
    Author:
    Paul Lorenz

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void accept(TokenVisitor visitor)
      Should call the appropriate visit method on the given visitor.
      ExecutionType getExecutionType()
      Returns the ExecutionType of the token.
      Set<? extends TokenSetMember> getTokenSetMemberships()
      Returns the set of TokenSetMembers tying this token to a token set.
      boolean isComplete()
      Returns true if this token has been completed, false otherwise.
      void markBacktracked()
      Marks the token as backtracked by changing the execution type.

    • Method Detail

      • isComplete

        boolean isComplete()
        Returns true if this token has been completed, false otherwise.
        Returns:
        True if this token has been completed

      • getExecutionType

        ExecutionType getExecutionType()
        Returns the ExecutionType of the token. For a normal token, which occurs as part of graph execution, the ExecutionType will be ExecutionType.Forward.
        Returns:
        The token execution type

      • markBacktracked

        void markBacktracked()
        Marks the token as backtracked by changing the execution type. If the execution type is ExecutionType.Forward it gets changed to ExecutionType.ForwardBacktracked. If the execution type is ExecutionType.UTurn it gets changed to ExecutionType.UTurnBacktracked. If the execution type is ExecutionType.Backtracked it stays the same. Any other type of change should not occur.

      • accept

        void accept(TokenVisitor visitor)
        Should call the appropriate visit method on the given visitor.
        Parameters:
        visitor - The visitor which is traversing the execution history.

      • getTokenSetMemberships

        Set<? extends TokenSetMember> getTokenSetMemberships()
        Returns the set of TokenSetMembers tying this token to a token set.
        Returns:
        The set of TokenSetMembers tying this token to a token set.
